meanings.definition: A loud, confused noise; a continued loud or tumultuous sound; noisy clamor.
meanings.sent1: The dins of the construction site could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were filled with the dins of traffic and chatter.
meanings.sent3: The dins of the children playing outside made the neighbors smile.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the dins of the party, she heard her favorite song playing.
meanings.sent5: The dins of the thunderstorm kept everyone indoors.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, confused noise; to utter with a clamor.
meanings.sent1: The children dinsed with excitement as they played in the park.
meanings.sent2: The protesters dinsed slogans demanding change.
meanings.sent3: The dog dinsed happily as its owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: She dinsed her frustration at the broken computer.
meanings.sent5: The birds dinsed joyfully at the break of dawn.
